item.title: Grand Theft Auto 6 Website Reveals Game-Changing Lucia Connection
item.description: Grand Theft Auto 6 fans were hit with some disappointing news recently—the game’s release has officially been pushed back. But while the delay stings, Rockstar didn’t leave fans hanging. Thanks to new character bios on Rockstar’s updated GTA 6 website, we now know that Lucia spent part of her life in Liberty City, where she was raised by her mother. We also learned that her father taught her how to fight at a young age, and she eventually ends up in prison for what’s described as “fighting for her family.” That phrase alone hints at deeper personal stakes and may help explain the motivations behind her criminal path.

item.title: Nintendo Could Still Raise Switch 2 Price
item.description:
Summary

  • Nintendo Switch 2 pricing for US buyers may increase due to Trump's tariffs.
  • Nintendo's President is cautious about potential price adjustments.
  • Concerns over US pricing resulted in a pre-order delay in the country.

The price of the Nintendo Switch 2 for buyers in the United States is not as set in stone as it once appeared to be, as tariffs continue to place uncertainty over the upcoming console's release. The company's president has recently commented on the pricing of the Nintendo Switch 2 for U.S.-based customers, who may potentially have to pay more for it than expected.

After many long months of rumors and speculation, the reveal of the Nintendo Switch 2 in early April confirmed a broad catalog of first and third-party games and some nice new features, including Joy-Cons that affix to the console's base through magnetic connections and possess mouse-like capabilities. Initial reports showed that the console itself would be available for $449.99, or bundled together with Mario Kart World for $499.99.

But recent comments from Nintendo President Shuntaro Furukawa are once again throwing those figures into question. As reported by Yahoo Japan, Furukawa indicated at a recent press conference that he is mindful of how U.S. president Donald Trump's tariffs could affect Japanese video game companies, and that any changes to those tariffs may affect the future price points offered in the U.S. market. "If the premise of tariffs changes significantly, we will consider and implement what kind of price adjustment will be made after taking into account multiple aspects," a translation of one of his comments states.

Nintendo Cautiosly Eyeing Higher Switch 2 Prices in the United States

At the console's reveal, there had been serious concerns about how it would be priced in the United States. These concerns were tied to the pre-order delay of the Switch 2, which only affected the United States as well as Canada. Soon after the console's reveal, Nintendo announced that while it would open pre-order sales to most of the world on April 9, that offer would not be valid for customers in the two countries due to "evolving market conditions" that were largely influenced by the global tariffs enacted by Trump. Ultimately, Nintendo opened up U.S. and Canadian pre-order sales for the console and its first-party games and accessories on April 24, more than two weeks after the rest of the world got its first shot.

Despite Trump's promise of working on trade deals with several countries, The Japan Times reports that negotiations with Japan were at a standstill as of April 7, with tariff czar Ryosei Akazawa stating that no negotiations can occur without the Trump administration addressing the current tariffs on the country. Furukawa seems to be proceeding cautiously regarding potential price increases, acknowledging that higher prices coupled with projections of higher cost of living in the United States could hurt sales in that market. Meanwhile, the latest round of Switch 2 pre-orders has sold out almost instantly, reflecting a high demand for Nintendo's product.

item.title: Control 2 Budget Will Be Less Than Alan Wake 2
item.description:
Summary

  • Control 2 is being developed on a smaller budget than Alan Wake 2, according to developer Remedy Entertainment.
  • Despite the lowered budget, Remedy expects Control 2 to deliver a high-quality experience.
  • Remedy aims for Control 2 to achieve profitability quicker than Alan Wake 2 did, with a break-even point of two million copies sold.

Remedy Entertainment has confirmed that its next major single-player game, Control 2 , is being developed on a smaller budget than the studio's last release - 2023's Alan Wake 2 . While the financial scale-back may incite worries among fans, Remedy remains confident in its ability to deliver another high-quality experience with the Control sequel.

2019's Control is widely regarded to be one of the best games Remedy has ever made, so it comes as no surprise that the Finnish developer is working on a sequel that further expands the universe. Given the technical and narrative expertise of Control , expectations for Control 2 are pretty high, even more so after the exceedingly positive reactions to Alan Wake 2 - Remedy's last major game release. However, while Alan Wake 2 was one of the most celebrated games of 2023, its commercial performance didn't quite live up to the praise.

Just earlier this year, Remedy announced that Alan Wake 2 had finally turned a profit over 15 months since its launch. This isn't very ideal for a critically-acclaimed, high-caliber AAA title, to say the least, and with budgets also skyrocketing in the games industry, Remedy has taken a step towards more financially manageable development. In a recent interview with Game File, Remedy Entertainment CEO Tero Virtala confirmed Control 2 is being developed on a budget of €50 million (approximately $57 million USD), co-financed with Stray and Outer Wilds publisher Annapurna Interactive.

Remedy Wants Control 2 to Be Profitable Quicker than Alan Wake 2 Was

Control 2 's budget is "a bit less" than what was spent on Alan Wake 2, but Virtala believes it's sufficient to produce a top-tier Remedy single-player experience. Remedy has calculated that it can break even if Control 2 sells around two million copies, and the studio will see significant profit if the game hits four or five million units sold. This strategic budgeting is part of Remedy's wider effort to transition from what Virtala described as "surviving to succeeding." He explained that Remedy is adopting a more business-savvy approach, encouraging developers to consider production costs and timelines more carefully while keeping quality uncompromised.

Control 2 is currently in full production, but it won't be the next release on Remedy's slate. That distinction goes to FBC: Firebreak , a co-op multiplayer spin-off game set in the Control universe, which releases on June 17, 2025, for PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC. Interestingly, FBC: Firebreak will launch into PlayStation Plus Extra and Xbox Game Pass on day one, and also marks Remedy's first foray into self-publishing.

item.title: How To Get More Blaster Tokens For Tatooine Treasures In Monopoly GO
item.description:
Get your gear ready because it’s time to dig in the Tatooine Treasures event in Monopoly GO . Sofia has returned, and this time we are helping her hunt for treasures on a Star Wars-themed board. In return, players will get some awesome rewards like the Grogu token, a five-star sticker pack, loads of dice rolls, and cash. The event runs for four days, from May 7 to May 11.

If you’ve played minigames in Monopoly GO before, you know the drill. You need special tokens to take part. For the Tatooine Treasures event, fans will need Blaster Tokens, which go perfectly with the Star Wars theme. These tokens allow you to dig and find rewards in the minigame. So wondering how to get more Blasters? Keep reading to learn some effective ways to stack them up in Monopoly GO .

How To Get Free Blasters For Tatooine Treasures in Monopoly GO

Events and Tournaments

The easiest way to get Blaster Tokens for the Tatooine Treasures minigame is by playing solo events and tournaments. Right now, there are two events running that can help you out: the Tatooine Nights solo event and the Stampede Sprint tournament.

  • Tatooine Nights gives you 147 Blaster Tokens in total.
  • Stampede Sprint offers 149 Blaster Tokens in total.

Below, players will find a list of all the Tatooine Nights milestones that reward you with Blaster Tokens.

Quick Wins

Quick Wins are one of the easiest ways to get a few Blaster tokens in Monopoly GO . These are super simple daily tasks like rolling the dice a few times or upgrading something on your board. You get three new tasks every day, and they don’t take much effort at all.

Here are the Quick Wins for May 8, 2025:

  • Roll the dice 5 times
  • Upgrade one landmark
  • Complete one Bank Heist

Eight Hourly Gifts

Every eight hours, you can head to the shop and grab some free rewards. These gifts sometimes give you a few Blaster tokens and some dice. It’s not a huge amount, but free stuff is always nice.

Are There Any Blaster Token Links for Tatooine Treasures?

No, there aren’t any Blaster Token links right now for the Tatooine Treasures event. If Scopely drops any, we’ll update this page right away.

item.title: Helldivers 2 Leak Reveals Upcoming Invasion Event
item.description:
Summary

  • Arrowhead Game Studios may be testing and Illuminate invasion event at Widow's Harbor on May 13, according to a leak.
  • Helldivers 2 features intense galactic warfare against diverse alien factions.
  • Potential multi-faction missions and new campaign types are being tested for Helldivers 2.

A recent leak from a prominent Helldivers 2 source indicates that Arrowhead Game Studios is testing an Illuminate invasion event set for Widow's Harbor on May 13. Helldivers 2 , a cooperative third-person shooter released early last year for PC and PlayStation 5, got a steaming-hot start. Powered by streaming events by some of the biggest influencers and gamers, Helldivers 2 quickly became one of the most popular multiplayer games. It builds on the legacy of its 2015 predecessor, Helldivers , with an emphasis on a live-service model and community-forward events.

Helldiver 2 offers intense galactic warfare against Terminids, Automatons, and the Illuminate. With a team of player-controlled elite soldiers from Super Earth, equipped with high-tech weaponry and armor, players battle ever larger and more dangerous swarms of enemies. The Illuminate, a technologically advanced alien faction, was introduced in Helldivers 2 's Omens of Tyranny update in December. The dark and powerful race is also present in the original Helldivers .

With limited Illuminate-exclusive content, now a trusted leaker has tweeted that Arrowhead is actively testing an Illuminate invasion at Widow's Harbor. This coincides with an event announced by the developers of Helldivers 2 at Widow's Harbor in Free Springs Retreat known as "Singularity party." It will take place on May 13 and offer partygoers music by DJ Guard Dawg and more. The leak suggests that instead of a happy-go-lucky beach party, this could mark the destructive arrival of the Illuminate.

Invasion Escalates Illuminate's Presence in Helldivers 2

With the same source offering insights into Widow's Harbor's importance immediately after the party announcement, players have been waiting for more confirmation. Now, with additional details revealed by the leaker, the invasion seems to be as good as locked in. However, even amid seemingly solid leaks, details are scarce. Regardless, the event seems to be one of the more noteworthy days of the year for Helldivers 2 .

Further details indicate Arrowhead is also testing multi-faction missions and new campaign types for Helldivers 2 , potentially integrating Terminids, Automatons, and Illuminate in a single operation. Although the "singularity party" is framed by the leaker as an Illuminate invasion, there's a chance that this event will bring even more to the table. If true, it would mark one of the most ambitious content updates for the game so far.

The game's success is driven by consistent updates like Helldivers 2 's new Warbond revealed May 8. Since its superb launch, the game's popularity has waned significantly. However, with community-driven events and new updates, the game is likely going to see another bump, like after the Omens of Tyranny update, making this an excellent time to pick up Helldivers 2 again.
